newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada NEB orders TCPL to cut line pressure.
newsitem.headline: Canada NEB orders TCPL to cut line pressure.

text.p: Canada's National Energy Board said on Wednesday it ordered TransCanada PipeLines Ltd to cut the operating pressure in a section of its Canadian natural gas mainline by 10 percent.
The NEB said TransCanada would be forced to run the northern Ontario section at reduced pressure until its safety could be verified.
Under the order, the cut in pressure was to take effect immediately on a section of TransCanada's system between Falcon Lake, Manitoba and Ignace, Ontario.
The length of pipe includes a section that was the site of a December 11 line rupture and explosion, which was blamed on general corrosion.
"Subsequent hydrostatic testing in the area revealed other serious corrosion," the NEB said.
It said the pressure would be reduced until May 31 or when the pipeline's integrity could be confirmed.
The pressure reduction was not expected to have affect firm service natural gas shippers, the NEB said.
